intro: Hieracium subcaudatum, commonly known as the short-tailed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium subcaudatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and seeds.
